title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic reveals £50 deal with Romelu Lukaku while they were at Manchester United
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has revealed he offered to make a deal with Romelu Lukaku for every time he would make a decent first touch for Manchester United.

The strikers played together briefly during the 2017-18 season where United finished second in the Premier League under Jose Mourinho.

In an interview published with La Gazetta Dello Sport, the LA Galaxy star warned his formed club Inter Milan not to 'expect good technique from Romelu Lukaku.'

Zlatan Ibrahimovic (left) revealed that he offered Lukaku £50 for every decent touch he made

Ibrahimovic said: 'At Manchester United, we made a bet - 'I'll give you £50 for every decent first touch you make.' He replied: 'What do I win if I get them all right?'

'I told him nothing, he would simply become a better player. For the record, he never accepted the bet! Perhaps he was afraid of losing.

'Joking aside, Lukaku has this mad hunger to prove himself to the world and I'm sure he will do well at Inter too.'

Romelu Lukaku's technique was often questioned during his time at Old Trafford

Despite a solid goal scoring record at Manchester United netting 28 times in 66 appearances, Lukaku often had his doubters with his failure to perform in big games seeing some fans lose patience with the striker.

The 26-year-old's first touch and technique was often questioned during his stint at Old Trafford.

Despite not bringing any new strikers in, Manchester United let Lukaku go to Inter Milan who signed the Belgian for a club record £73m deal.

United have arguably missed Lukaku's goals and are languishing in 12th place in the Premier League having only scored nine goals in eight games.

Lukaku has so far has scored three goals in seven for Inter Milan, but he will hoping to repeat the same kind of success that Ibrahimovic achieved at the San Siro.

The Swedish striker scored 57 goals in 88 games for Inter winning three league titles.

Ibrahimovic's comments came during an interview where he said he could return to Serie A one day and that it was 'the most difficult league in the world.'
description: In an interview with La Gazetta Dello Sport, Zlatan Ibrahimovic revealed he offered to make a £50 bet with Romelu Lukaku for every decent first touch he made at Manchester United.
